frameDefinitions: The answer to a Question is under discussion in a Group, which still  has a difference of opinion among its members.
An Arguer presents a Content, along with Support, to an Addressee.
A Whole breaks apart into Pieces, resulting in the loss of the Whole (and in most cases, no piece that has a separate function).
A stretch of linguistic discourse or a Text that a Communicator produces has a Topic that it is about.
A Topical_entity has properties which are affected by the existence and association of an Entity.
A Recipient starts off without the Theme in their possession, and then comes to possess it.
frameExamples: Firstly, it is quite clear the <t>issue</t> in this context was not so much apostasy as much as it was treason.
Jan <t>argued</t> that the evidence was inadmissable.
The plane violently <t>broke apart</t> in mid-air.
By the 1920s a characteristic book <t>had</t> black and white photographic illustrations only .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Question</fen> is an open proposition the answer to which is under dispute.
The time interval during which the <fen>Question</fen> exists as a problem for the <fen>Group</fen>.

The <fen>Arguer</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to entertain the <fen>Content</fen>, which can be a proposition to be believed or a course of action to be taken, based on the <fen>Support</fen> presented.
The <fen>Arguer</fen> presents the <fen>Content</fen> before the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The Time at which an <fen>Arguer</fen> makes an argument for the <fen>Content</fen>.
This role identifies the location where an argument is made by an <fen>Arguer</fen>.
The <fen>Whole</fen> goes into <fen>Pieces</fen> which were not (necessarily) definable subparts prior to breaking.
The <fen>Pieces</fen> result from the breaking apart of the <fen>Whole</fen>.
The time at which the breaking apart takes place.w
The location at which the breaking apart takes place.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is what a <fen>Text</fen> is about.
A set of propositions that is coherent in being about a <fen>Topic</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who has produced a <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> produces <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
Some entity, abstract or concrete, which is stated to exist and be associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.
The entity under discussion, whose states and properties are impacted by its association with the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists and is associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>
The place where the <fen>Entity</fen> is associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Recipient</fen> indicates the entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that changes possession.
When the event occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> denotes where the Getting takes place.
listRoleExamples: The issue is <fex>who will have control of Iraq's rich oil resources</fex>.

The issue <fex>at the time</fex> was whether or not to relocate the Rennes-based part of
the team to California.
Jan argued <fex>that the evidence was inadmissable</fex>.
<fex>Jan</fex> argued that the evidence was inadmissable.
The government argued <fex>in August</fex> that the prisoners should not be released
The young men will be arguing their policies <fex>in the school auditorium</fex>.
In his book, <fex>Smithers</fex> discusses cotton production.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Professional Fire Fighters of Massachusetts
